name: Hotel Savoy Amsterdam

reviews.text: The hotel was slightly out of the way but a very short tram ride to the center of town. The room was small but quite comfortable and clean. Staff very helpful and free internet. Breakfast was a small but adequate buffet of homemade breads and other selected European specialties.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Staff

reviews.text: Excellent value for money with very friendly and helpful staff! Great location and easy access to public transport. Rooms a little bit small but clean. This hotel is great for couples of all ages who wishes to explore Amsterdam from early till late and then sleep somewhere safe, clean and quiet to recharge your batteries for the next days round of adventure!
reviews.title: Amsterdam in 3 days!
Ideal for short break.
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights for our trip to Amsterdam. On arriving we had to pay city tax which was about €20. We booked this hotel through easyjet and it was classed as 4*. We stayed in a double room which was a bit small but ideal just to sleep and shower for me and the girlfriend. The room was clean, Shower was brilliant, Wifi in the hotel was free. They had a restaurant/food area which we never tried. Tram stop was outside hotel no.25 goes to central station 15 min journey. Hotel was just a short tram journey to Amsterdam.

It is a good hotel. A little bit expensive and the breakfast was not inclusive in the price which was aa down side of it. Rooms were clean and quiet. Probably we got the rooms on the old side of the hotel and those seem to be smaller. There is a tram line just in front of the hotel which takes you in 15 minutes to the centre. We tried walking and it gets you there in 25 minutes. Very nice service.
reviews.title: Good location, clean but small rooms

reviews.text: Stayed one night. Comfortable bed. Good shower. Room a bit on the small side but it was good value. I would stay again
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did not book directly with the hotel. Booked 2 rooms online and encountered some surprises upon check in. When I booked the room I thought my credit card was charged but there was only a hold put on the card. I had to pay for the rooms on arrival and the exchange rate was higher and resulted in an additional $40 dollars. The website indicated that there was parking available. Yes there is but it is about a 20 minute tram ride and walk or expensive hourly parking on the street near the hotel that was always full. We took the tram to the parking and had to drag our suitcases to and from the hotel. The parking garage was 16 euros. The rooms were clean and modern. The bathroom had European style tub/shower, toiletries, and a hairdryer. Our room faced the street with the tram so there was some noise when the tram was operating. Breakfast was 15 euros and was adequate. There were restaurants and shops near the hotel. A large flea market is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. You can buy a day pass for the tram and it was easy to get to the town center by tram. Hop on hop off buss stop was a short walk from the hotel and a great way to see Amsterdam.
reviews.title: Just OK
Good value clean hotel
reviews.text: Stayed at the Savoy for 2 nights on business. Good location with clean presentable rooms. Check in fast and efficient with all wifi details given. Room very clean and fresh with view over street. No noise nuisance. Breakfast was adequate with a good choice but a more powerful toaster would be useful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Not bad but not 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all the stay was good value compared to other locales and would certainly have no problems in recommending or staying there again.
reviews.title: dissapointed

reviews.text: Arrival: Check in was simple and the member of staff friendly.
reviews.title: Quiet, comfortable hotel close to RAI Exhibition center

reviews.text: If you have a congress or festivity in the RAI or neighbourhood, this is a good hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: Good hotel for 1 or 2 nights while on congress

reviews.text: Its walking distance, has nice rooms and is not Very expensive.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The downside however is that it can be very noisy in the morning from the traffic and in my case (having a room on the first floor) the preparation of the breakfast area.No need for including breakfast, because on your way to the congress venue or the city there ar lots of small dining rooms.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are working at rai this is a very good location only 5minute walk .if you have breakfast make sure you get in early as the bacon did not seemed to get replaced when gone! No kettle in room but has fridge . Nice large slim television in room.
reviews.title: Small but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If looking for hotel near the rai this wood meet your needs
reviews.title: Best beds ever

reviews.text: Our travel agent booked this hotel for us. We were not impressed at all. The pictures really do not depict how bad it is. The rooms are very dark. The bathroom is tiny (only room for one person to stand) and the shower water will not stay in the shower, so the floor floods. There is a makeup mirror, but it was mounted 6 feet off the ground...and I am only 5'4". We had 2 rooms, one overlooked a court yard (sort of), the other had a window, but the bottom of the window as 6 feet off the ground, so it made it impossible to look out or open or close the window. There was a small cafeteria-looking dining room for breakfast. The lobby reminded me of one in a small US motel. The sheets were scratchy and we thought we had book a king bed for ourselves, but we had 2 twins and were unable to change it. It is on the Tram line, but the 25 tram was not working the day we were there. It was a 10 - 15 minute walk to get to the nearest working tram. It is not in a great part of the city either. I would not recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: If you like a small hotel...

reviews.text: I stayed in this Hotel in early August 2012 with a friend in a Twin Share room. (Room 3) Although the Reception staff were lovely the room was so small we hardly had room for the two of us and our luggage. The bathroom was small but OK although the shower floor looked and smelt mouldy. The big problem I had here was that I chose to sleep in the bed nearest the window and broke out 2 days later in a HORRIBLE bed bug rash. I ended up at a Hospital for medication soon after that. I would suggest that anyone who stays here pulls the bedding apart and checks it before settling in for the night. The bed I slept on had a thick wool underlay - must have been crawling with bugs !!!!!!
reviews.title: Basic Hotel - a bit out of the way for tourists

reviews.text: Very impressive room with the most comfortable adjustable bed. The location is nice (around 30mins walk from Dam Square) so the locale feels a lot less touristy. There's some lovely places to eat/drink nearby and it's handy for the Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. The only disappointment was the lack of friendliness on arrival. There was zero attempt at any interaction or welcome. This was the case every time I left or returned back to the hotel during my stay. Overall, it's a nice hotel and despite the above, I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Lovely clean room, unwelcome reception.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a pretty average hotel (definitely not 4 star UK standard). Our comments are as follows after a three night stay...
reviews.title: Average Hotel but not in a great neighbourhood

description: Amsterdam Fine Hotels has transformed the Savoy Hotel Amsterdam to an extraordinary, non-smoking, Four Star Hotel.
